intro: Nicotiana maxima, commonly known as the wild tobacco plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple, and its broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known species like tomatoes and potatoes. It is known for its high nicotine content, which makes it both toxic and useful in various applications. Nicotiana maxima is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance and resilience in various climates.
